titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Carole A. Oglesby papers SSC.MS.00492

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-02-15 13:02:54 -0500.

change.item: This record was migrated from InMagic DB Textworks to ArchivesSpace.
First version of finding aid published

physdesc.extent: (96 record cartons, 1 letter size document box, 1 half letter size document box, 4 oversize boxes, and 1 flat file)
(23 external USB drives, 12 CDs, 27 3.5 floppy disks, 9 DVDs, 17 VHS tapes)

did.abstract: Carole A. Oglesby was one of the pioneers in the women's sports movement from the 1950s through the 1990s and was also one of the first "out" lesbians in U.S. athletics. The bulk of this collection represents Carole Oglesby's professional activities and research, and as such, it contains materials related to the subject of women and sport from the 1960s to the early 2000s.
did.langmaterial: The majority of the collection is in English, but it includes materials in French, Spanish, Russian, Japanese, Chinese, German, Arabic, Norwegian, Romanian, and Finnish.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The most recent accessions for this collection are open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections. Per the terms of the deed of gift, this collection is "closed until fully processed," so the contents of the 2003 donation remain closed at this time.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials in this resource were donated to the Sophia Smith Collection by Carole A. Oglesby in multiple groups in 2003 and 2018 (accessions 03S-70, 2018-A-0001, 2018-A-0007, and 2018-S-0078).

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Carole A. Oglesby was one of the pioneers in the women's sports movement from the 1950s through the 1990s and was also one of the first "out" lesbians in U.S. athletics.

Oglesby earned her A.B. and her M.S. in physical education at the University of California, Los Angeles, in 1961 and 1964 respectively; in 1969 she received her Ph.D. from Purdue University. She served as the first president of the Association for Intercollegiate Athletics for Women (AIAW), and as the first president of Women Sport International; she opposed the merger of the AIAW with the National Collegiate Athletic Association in 1982.

Oglesby has served as president of the National Association for Girls and Women in Sport, and as trustee for the Women's Sports Foundation (WSF). She organized WSF's "The New Agenda" conference, which set the research agenda for women in sport in the early 1980s; one of the most serious issues encountered at this conference involved homophobia in sport. She also served on the Executive Committee of the United States Collegiate Sports Council for twenty-five years, an arm of the International Federation of University Sport, which organizes the World University Games.

Oglesby wrote "Women in Sport: From Myth to Reality"; was the editor of the Encyclopedia of Women in Sport in America, as well as several other monographs; and authored hundreds of articles, book chapters, and book reviews. She has also been the editor of several journals relating to education, sport, sex roles, and psychology.

Oglesby has travelled the globe, explicating the connection between women's sports and women's rights, and she serves as a consultant to many athletic and women's groups. After nearly forty years of teaching at the University of Massachusetts at Amherst, Purdue University, and Temple University, Oglesby went back to school to earn a Ph.D. in Counseling Psychology at Temple University. She is certified as a trained practitioner in eye movement desensitisation reprocessing, and taught at California State University, Northridge, where she headed the department of kinesiology. Oglesby currently serves as the International Policy and Program Advisor for the Women's Sports Foundation.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: This online finding aid currently provides detailed description of only the most recent additions to this collection. The unprocessed 2003 accession has an unpublished container list that can be sent to you upon request by contacting specialcollections@smith.edu

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: As a preservation measure, researchers must use digital copies of audiovisual materials in this collection. Please consult with Special Collections staff to request the creation of and access to digital copies.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Carole A. Oglesby papers, Sophia Smith Collection, SSC-MS-00492, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Mass.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The first series of this collection, the 2003 accession, has not been processed, in the sense that archival arrangement and description beyond creating minimal box lists has not been done. Additionally, it needs to be screened for confidential student and other records before access to it can be provided to researchers. A few books not authored by Oglesby in this accession were found to be moldy and discarded at the time of accessioning, as was an original copy of Oglesby's thesis, a photocopy of which was retained.

The second and third series of this collection (Accessions 2018-S-0001 and 2018-S-0007) were received from the donor in 40 cartons with minimal organization. See those series descriptions for details of processing activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The bulk of this collection represents Carole Oglesby's professional activities and research, and as such, it contains materials related to the subject of women and sport from the 1960s to the early 2000s.

Subtopics include homophobia in sport, racial awareness in women's sport, Title IX, the relationship between women's sport and feminism, and international women's conferences. Organizations represented in the collection include the American Association for Health, Physical Education, Recreation and Dance; National Association for Girls and Women in Sport; United States Olympic Committee; United States Collegiate Sports Council; International Federation of University Sport (IFUS); American Association for Applied Sports Psychology; Commission on the Status of Women; and the Women's Sports Foundation. Projects and conferences in the collection include the New Agenda, a conference planning the future of research in women's sport; the COACH project, which worked with Pennsylvania high school coaches; the 1977 Torch Run to Houston; and International Women's Year.
The collection also contains a small amount of student and administration files from Temple University and the University of Massachusetts at Amherst; and Oglesby's financial records, correspondence, and manuscripts. It also contains some materials originally belonging to Christine Shelton, related to women and sport.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: To the extent that she owns copyright, Carole A. Oglesby has assigned the copyright in her works to Smith College; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Carole A. Oglesby, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

physdesc.extent: (69 record cartons, plus oversize boxes and flat files)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is "closed until fully processed" per the terms of the deed of gift.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of the unprocessed accession of materials given by Carole Oglesby in 2003.

The bulk of this accession contains materials related to the subject of women and sport from the 1960s to the early 2000s. Subtopics include homophobia in sport, racial awareness in women's sport, Title IX, the relationship between women's sport and feminism, and international women's conferences. Organizations include the American Association for Health, Physical Education, Recreation and Dance; National Association for Girls and Women in Sport; United States Olympic Committee; United States Collegiate Sports Council; International Federation of University Sport (IFUS); American Association for Applied Sports Psychology; Commission on the Status of Women; and the Women's Sports Foundation. Projects and conferences include the New Agenda, a conference planning the future of research in women's sport; the COACH project, which worked with Pennsylvania high school coaches; the 1977 Torch Run to Houston; and International Women's Year. Other materials include student and administration files of Temple University and the University of Massachusetts at Amherst; and Oglesby's financial records, correspondence, and manuscripts. Contains a box or two of materials appearing to belong to Christine Shelton, related to women and sport.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: A box list for this series, created at the time of accessioning, can be sent to you upon request.

physdesc.extent: (15 record cartons, 1 flat box, 1 full size letter document box, 1 flat folder)

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were received in 20 boxes and 1 mailing tube with minimal organization. All needed to be re-foldered and re-boxed. Existing organization was retained where possible at the file level, and like materials were grouped into boxes together. Confidential patient records, papers relating to Christine M. Shelton, and unnecessary duplicates were removed. The patient records were shredded, the records from Christine M. Shelton were moved to her collection, and the duplicates were discarded.
Books written by or with articles by Carole Oglesby were retained. Books or articles with inscriptions or dedications had the inscription or dedication photocopied and the books were donated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession contains information and materials from the various women's sports organizations Oglesby was a member of, materials from courses she took and taught, materials from lectures and presentations, publications, media, and conference materials. It also includes personal correspondence, photographs, and other items, such as Oglesby's course work both as an undergraduate and graduate student.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: One record carton of books, not by or about Oglesby, were donated to the Northampton League of Women Voters for their annual book fair.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials in this accession, like Accession 2018-S-0001 came from the same storage unit and were received in 20 boxes with minimal organization. All needed to be re-foldered and re-boxed. Existing organization was retained where possible at the file level, and like materials were grouped into boxes together. Confidential patient records, papers relating to Christine M. Shelton, and unnecessary duplicates were removed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession, like previous ones, contains materials related to the subject of women and sport from the 1960s to the present day. It contains information and materials from the various women's sports organizations Oglesby was a member of, materials from courses she took and taught, materials from lectures and presentations, publications, media, and conference materials. Also includes personal correspondence, photographs, and items.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Three record cartons of material created by/related to Christine M. Shelton were added to her papers held by the Sophia Smith Collection.

scopecontent.p: This accession, like previous ones, contains materials related to the subject of women and sport from the 1960s to the present day. It contains information and materials from the various women's sports organizations Oglesby was a member of, materials from courses she took and taught, materials from lectures and presentations, publications, media, and conference materials. Also includes personal correspondence, photographs, and items.
